143.content:
The trees pierced the air, casting you into their shadow. Every now and again, something skittered through the bushes, but you couldn't catch a glimpse. There was no path - your only option was to brave the foliage hoping to find shelter soon. It wouldn't be pleasant, but staying on the beach would get you nowhere.

After a few minutes of fighting past the thick overgrowth you were already drenched in sweat. It had already been hot on the beach - the sun bathed the island in warm light - but now you felt as if you were melting. The air was thick and damp and despite the shade, there was no escape from the tropical heat. Worse, there was no sign of anything servicable for a shelter - much less any indication of civilization.

Just as you considered turning back towards the shore, you suddenly slipped. The ground beneath you vanished without warning. No sound escaped you, as you fell downwards.
But as soon as you started falling, you stop, only barely catching yourself from tumbling into the dirt. Catching your breath, you looked around. The hole you fell into was not all that deep - maybe three to four feet - but rather large, nonetheless. The walls of the small pit were smooth. The ground itself, on the other hand, was completely covered by furrows and lines, the earth rough. It didn't look like someone had dug it, but you couldn't explain how a hole like this could have emerged on it's own.
Getting up, you climbed out, ready to continue your march. But just as you get yourself out of the hole, you almost slipp again - into a series of smaller impressions. Five, in fact, very close together.

A gear turned in your head. Hadn't you seen a shape like this somewhere before? You looked back at the large pit, then again at the ones infront of you. A suspicion formed in your mind - but that was impossible... was it?
There was only one way to find out. Grabbing a low branch you pulled yourself up a nearby tree, climbing upwards until you could see the holes below. You blanched as you saw them from above - now you recognized the shape for sure!

The ground had been crushed in by a gigantic foot! That's what the holes were - a footprint. Large enough that you could fall in it and not even realize, what it was. It was longer than you were tall! The smaller holes, undoubtedly dug by gigantic toes, could easily fit your head. But worst of all, on their tips were small, sharp and angular prints that you hadn't noticed before. Still, you knew what they were.

Clawprints.

For a moment, you were simply stunned. You had never heard of something this large to exists - except dinosaurs of course. Had you somehow stumbled upon the sanctuary of an extinct species? No, the footprint looked far to human for that. But that made even less sense!

You looked upwards. It was hard to visualize, but you tried to imagine the size of this creature. If you were right, whatever it was would reach over the canopy by a lot - and the trees weren't exactly small.
Your eyes wandered over the jungle. For the first time you noticed a lot of the higher branches broken off and lying on the ground. Almost as if a path had been cut through, only by blunt force. Then, suddenly, you got an idea!

You scanned the 'path' intently, keeping your eyes to the ground. You didn't have to search for long. Only a few yards a head, you could see a big part of foliage flattened. Then another footprint. Clawmarks on the roots below.
It was a trail.

Your mind reeling, you leaned back. What should you do? Whatever it was that roamed this strange island, it was obviously dangerous. You were barely the size of a rat to it. Finding shelter was now more important than ever - and more complicated. Sleeping out in the open was out of the question, for sure.

But then again... the prints looked human. Very human, in fact. Maybe, whatever the giant creature was, was also intelligent? It wouldn't be all that surprising, now that you knew that something like this could even exist. As unlikely as it was, maybe you would find help. Or, at least, the giant would surely have mountains of food that you could scavenge.
And most importantly, you were curious. You knew it wasn't sensible, but something inside you was desperate to get at least a glimpse of the creature - after all, you were certain no one else had ever seen something like it...

But also, you were packed by curiosity. The eyes of the shark were different than from any other animal you had ever seen. They glimmered with intelligence. 15132.content:
You'd hoped that perhaps Tatiana was a gentle giant, one who would help you get off this crazy island and back home. However, the look in her eyes chilled you to the bone. She looked at you like you weren't even a person, just a minuscule thing that happened to catch her attention. Perhaps subconsciously she ran her tongue over her lips at the sight of you. You did not think that was a good sign.

"Um, Miss Tatiana," you said nervously, "it's been a pleasure to meet you but I really should be heading home. May you please put me down so I can find a way off this island?"

"Oh?" Tatiana asked, amused. "What's the hurry? We've barely gotten a chance to get to know one another."

"R-right," you stammered. "It's just that my family's probably gonna be worried sick about me so I should leave as soon as possible."

"Your family?" Tatiana sounded intrigued. "Are they with you on this island by any chance? Any other little... friends... for me to make?" She said the word "friends" in the least friendly way imaginable. You swallowed nervously.

"Well, no, I'm alone. I was in a sailboat race around the world when I washed up--"

"Fascinating," Tatiana said dryly. "So you are alone. Pity. I would've liked a few more tinies. A colony of you would've come in very useful with my business, but I guess I shouldn't be greedy. Some poor women here have gone their entire lives without bagging a man. I should count myself lucky to have found one. And you should consider yourself lucky that you have the great privilege of meeting a goddess such as myself... You do consider it an honor, don't you?"

"Oh yes--tremendous honor!" you said, not wanting to upset her. "But... like I was saying... my family--"

"My family, my family, blah, blah, blah, do you talk about anything other than yourself? I have a sister and you don't see me droning on about it. Forget about your family. You'll never see them again, not unless they wash up here looking for you. Amazon Peony is magic. No one who washes up here can ever leave, not someone as glorious and powerful as myself. Not that I'd ever want to leave, mind you. This island is a paradise that provides everything us amazons could ask for: Pets... Toys... Slaves... Food."

She fixed you with her gaze and a chill ran up your spine. You didn't know which of those things she considered you, but absolutely none of them were good. Suddenly those skull-shaped earrings looked a bit too ominous.

"Please let me go!" you squealed. You wiggled inbetween her pudgy fingers even though you were hundreds of feet in the air. Falling would mean death, but it might be worth it compared to whatever she had planned.

"Foolish, mousey man. Your kind is at the bottom of the food chain here on Amazon Peony. Nothing here shows mercy, me included. But I'll teach you all about that soon enough."

Before you could keep pleading, Tatiana raised you to her massive cleavage and shoved you inside. The mountainous mammarys compressed you on either side. The thunderous sound of her heart pounded in your ears. She swayed her hips as she walked, making you nauseous from the motion. Only the fear of what she'd do to you if you threw up on her breasts stopped you from vomiting. Her footsteps brought down trees and the island shook from her steps. The heat of the day made her sweat, and the salty beads ran down her cleavage and drenched you. After what felt like an hour, Tatiana stopped moving, and the pressure around you became even more intense as she sat down. With a squelching noise, she pulled you out of her cleavage and you gasped for air.

"Home sweet home."

You looked around and realized you were in a colossal wooden hut. Its size was impossibly huge to you. It was a home for a mountain. Animal skins and heads hung on the walls. You gulped at the size of them. A woman as huge as Tatiana was one thing, but a tiger too?! That terrified you more than words could describe. Your captor set you down on the dinner table and inspected you casually.

You coughed awkwardly. "Nice place you have here," you mumbled.

"I'm glad you approve. See? Isn't this much nice than being alone in that scary, old jungle."

You didn't necessarily agree with that, but you didn't want to anger someone who already showed such disregard for your happiness.

"At least there aren't any wild animals in here," you said.

"True enough. Except for Betsy, of course."

"Betsy?"

You heard a terrifying slithering sound right behind you. With a whimper you turned around. An emerald-green snake the size and length of an airplane runway was behind you. Her pink tongue flicked out of her mouth. Her yellow eyes were fixed intently on you. Somehow, just from looking at her, you knew that she wasn't an ordinary snake. The look in her eyes was frighteningly intelligent, almost human.

"Say hello to Betsy, Mousey Man," Tatiana said, smirking.

You weren't sure if Tatiana was being serious but you didn't want to offend the giant or her pet either way. "H-hello, Betsy," you stammered.

The snake only stared at you. You weren't sure what you were supposed to do next. You turned to address Tatiana when a lightning flash movement occurred out of the corner of your eye. In an instant you were plunged into pitch black darkness, surrounded by moist flesh. You realize the snake had snatched you in her mouth and immediately began to scream as she worked you to the back of her throat without issue.

Tatiana watched the whole affair with a bored expression on her face. She sighed as the snake swallowed you whole and rubbed her forehead in annoyance.

"Betsy, I swear to god," she mumbled.

The snake was already hurriedly retreating with her prize, her prize tucked away inside her and crying. She slithered off the table and on to the floor. She was almost at the door when Tatiana got up, marched after her and grabbed her by the tail. The snake wiggled in protest but Tatiana ignored her, and leaned in to address the struggling mass in her snake's belly. She listened for a few seconds as you begged and pleaded for help.

"First law of the jungle, Mouse," Tatiana said slowly and clearly to the bulge in her pet's stomach. "Eat or be eaten. That display was pathetic. You literally didn't last a second. I have half a mind to leave you in there to digest."

Your wails of terror made Tatiana smirk. She brought Betsy back to the table and pinched her hands beneath the bulge you made in the reptile. She ran her fingers up the length of the snake, forcing her to throw you back up. Betsy hissed at her angrily and thrashed, not wanting to relinquish her meal, but she couldn't stop from Tatiana squeezing you out of her. The snake snapped its jaws beneath your kicking feet, trying to reclaim you, but Tatiana pulled your form out of reach.

"Nice try, Betsy," she said, then turned to you. "As for you, Mouse, next time I expect you to put up a fight. Otherwise I will leave you in there. If my sister can catch you so easily, she deserves to have you for a snack."

You were too busy shaking on the palm of her hand for the words to sink in instantly, but when they did, they hit you like a ton of bricks.

"YOUR WHAT?!" you shrieked. You looked to the snake that was staring daggers at you. It seemed personally offended that you'd escaped being her meal.

"Told you I had a sister," Tatiana said in a bored tone. "She wasn't born that way, obviously. Some of the women here can transform into animal forms, if they so choose. Betsy's chosen to remain in that form for the past two years, I can't talk her out of it... She always did take survival of the fittest a bit too far." The snake hissed at her angrily and slithered off the table to the floor in a huff. Tatiana shrugged. "Little sisters and magic islands? Can't explain either of them, eh?"

This was all too much for you. Women the size of mountains. Magical islands that trapped you on them for all eternity. Little sisters who transformed into snakes because sure, why the hell not?! This place was crazy!

"Anyway Betsy, no eating this one," Tatiana said over her shoulder. "Not without my say so, anyway. I want to see if he's useful for anything first. Besides, I found him. If anyone has the right to eat him, it's me."

When Tatiana looked away, Betsy stuck her tongue out at her sister. You had the feeling that Tatiana's warning meant less than nothing to her.

"What do you mean by wanting to see if I'm useful for anything?" you asked numbly. You dreaded the answer but in this crazy place, you may as well find out as much as you can, if the answers would only confuse and terrify you.

"Tiny men are a rare luxury here, Mouse," Tatiana explained. "Like I said, we can use you for whatever we want. Some women keep guys like you as pets, others as slaves or food, others still as toys for more... intimate desires." You repressed a shudder at the thought of being used intimately by any woman as huge as Tatiana.

"I figure I'll try using you in whatever way I can think of, and if you can't cut the mustard, well..."

Tatiana slapped her mountainous belly, causing it to jiggle ominously. You could hear the sloshing and gurgles from inside. If that wasn't bad enough, over the giant's shoulder you could see Betsy staring at you. The snake lifted her tail and pointed directly at you, then opened her mouth and pointed inside.

The strength went out of your legs and you fell to your knees. This place was a living nightmare. Be a slave or be dinner. Eat or be eaten. In your terrified mind, there seemed no escape from the latter.

Tatiana was a cruel mistress. The day passed and she worked you to the bone. You could still hear her voice booming in your ears. "Mouse, give me a manicure! Mouse, give me a foot massage! Mouse, rub suntan lotion on my backside! Mouse, remove the piece of lettuce stuck in my teeth!" Over and over, she made demands of you, not caring if the job she assigned you was suicidal. The snake had disappeared at some point during the day but you had no idea where. You didn't kid yourself into thinking that meant you were safe though. You underestimated her once and paid for it. Given your borderline microscopic form, it took forever, and the entire time you had to listen to the deafening growls of Tatiana's stomach, knowing that if you failed her at all, you'd end up in there as another speck of food. You'd just finished when Tatiana yawned loudly and plucked you between two fat fingers.

"What an exhausting day," she said. "Before I hit the hay, I'll give you your employee evaluation... You suck. Honestly, that entire display was disappointing. I expect much better from you if you want me to spare you in the future, Mouse. I won't take it easy on you like I did today. Understand?"

"Yes, Tatiana," you shouted, terrified of making her mad.

"Good. Now let me show you where you'll be sleeping."

Tatiana took you to her bedroom and plopped you on a nightstand next to her bed. She then went to her closet, rummaged around, and pulled out a large terrarium. Inside were rocks, dirt and leaves. From your perspective, it was like another jungle.

"This is Betsy's old room before she started spending most nights in the jungle. I'm sure she won't mind if you used it."

She popped open the terrarium and dropped you inside without a care. For some reason, the inside of the terrarium stank to high heaven. One whiff was enough to make your eyes water. No wonder Betsy decided to live in a jungle if her sister never cleaned her cage. Tatiana tried to put the lid back on the terrarium but for some reason it stayed loose. She fit it on as best she could then shrugged her shoulders.

"Eh, good enough. Make yourself at home, Mouse. Maybe you can find some scraps of food in there Betsy didn't polish off."

"But what about the lid?" you squeaked. "It isn't safe! What if Betsy--"

Tatiana yawned loudly. "Relax, Mouse. I put Betsy in her place, she won't bother you."

"But--"

Tatiana ignored you and yawned again. "Quit your worrying and get some rest. You'll need it. You have a busy day ahead of you tomorrow." The fat titan plopped into bed without another word, wrapping the blanket over herself. Seconds later, she was snoring.

Sleep wasn't so easy for you. Though tired from the hard day's work, you stayed awake, patrolling your new home. Despite Tatiana's assurances, you were certain Betsy wouldn't be put off so easily. You needed to keep on your guard. You needed to stay awake. No matter how tired you were. You had... to stay... awake...

----

You woke up in the middle of the night and tried to untangle yourself from the covers. You must've been tossing and turning in your sleep because they were wrapped tight around you. And, was it your imagination or did they feel... scaly?

Your eyes shot open. It all came crashing back to you. The shipwreck, the island, the terrarium, Tatiana, and of course--

"BETSY!"

The giant snake had you wrapped tightly in her coils. Your fears were realized. She'd knocked off the lid and came back to claim her snack. You screamed for help from Tatiana but the giantess was snoring loudly, sleeping peacefully, unaware of what her sister was doing to you. You cries were cut off as Betsy squeezed you tighter.

"Hello... Mouse." You heard a cold voice speaking but it wasn't out loud. It was a voice inside your head and it was decidedly feminine. "Yes, it's me. My oaf of a sister interrupted our quality time before, but she won't now. She's a heavy sleeper. Now it's just you and me, Mouse."
